Detailed Description

StreamingReadInfo is the info object for holding all the information about a read operation. It inherits the properties from base class StreamingInfo and additionally defines properties for holding the pointer to the data to read, for the number of bytes requested in the read operation, for the number of bytes actually available for reading, and to signal end of stream. Use this calls for read operations only.

UINT32 StreamingReadInfo::GetRequestedByteCount (   )  const [inline]
 

Gets the number of bytes requested to be read by this read operation. The callback from the stream reader will occur, when the number of bytes are available. If this property is 0, the callback will occur as soon as any number of bytes are available.

Returns:
number of bytes requested in this read operation

void StreamingReadInfo::SetRequestedByteCount (  UINT32  requested_byte_count  )  [inline]
 

Sets the number of bytes requested in this read operation. The callback from the stream reader will occur, when the number of bytes are available. If this property is 0 the callback will occur as soon as any number of bytes are available.

Parameters:
requested_byte_count [in] number of bytes requested in this read operation
